headline.main: MURRAY TO STAY AS HEAD OF C.I.O.; Survey Shows All Factions Feel His Retention Is Vital to Maintain Unity

lead_paragraph: All factions in the C.I.O. will support Philip Murray for re-election as national president, a survey indicated yesterday. Mr. Murray, who has just recovered from a two-month illness, has made no public announcement of his intentions, but persons in his confidence say he will be a candidate to succeed himself at the forthcoming C.I.O. convention.
